channel.title: Playgrounds on Advising @ Brown Biostatistics
channel.description: Recent content in Playgrounds on Advising @ Brown Biostatistics

item.title: Group Meeting 6
item.description:
Preparing your Thesis Proposal

Format

This meeting will be a group discussion. The goal of this is for students to learn about the thesis/project proposal that will be due at the end of the summer.

Group Discussion

The discussion will discuss:

  • What is a thesis/project proposal?
  • How do you write a thesis/project proposal?
  • What steps do you need to take before the end of the semester.

Preparation for Meeting

Students will need to identify and set up meetings with faculty members prior to attending this meeting. Students will also read chapters 3-4 from Mauch and Namgi.

item.title: Group Meeting 5
item.description:
What is a Thesis/Project and How do you find the right advisor?



Format


The format of this session is a group discussion

Group Discussion


The purpose of this discussion is to begin thinking further about a thesis or project that students may want to work on. In previous meetings they have learned from previous students and even interviewed faculty members. This is their chance to discuss expectations of the Department’s thesis/project and to begin to figure out who they may want to work with.

Preparation for Meeting


Students will read chapters 1-2 from Mauch and Namgi.

item.title: Group Meeting 4
item.description:
Faculty Interview Reports



Format


This will be students final formal presentation. With every group having 5-6 students in it, students will have the opportunity to learn more about 5-6 faculty members research interests. This will give students a deeper view of the department. If you choose to come to the other groups meetings you may then hear about all faculty.

Preparation for Meeting


Students will prepare a 5 minute presentation which highlights an interview with the given faculty member. Each presentation should consist of 5-6 slides.

item.title: Group Meeting 3
item.description:
Large Group Meeting with Other Students

Format



Format

During this session students will get a chance to talk with 1-2 students who are currently engaged in their own thesis/project work. This will give students a chance to discuss selecting advisors, how to set up meetings, tips current students wished they had known before starting their thesis, etc…

Group Discussion


The last half of this session will be engaged in discussing the courses that they wish to take for their final year. Students will have the opportunity to discuss with their advisor and former students about these courses. Students then will each identify a different faculty member to interview.

Preparation for Meeting

Students need to come prepared with at least one question to ask the current students about projects and thesis.

item.title: Group Meeting 2
item.description:
Topics in Biostatistics, Health Data Science or Public Health.



Format


This session will be the first formal presentation. Students will discuss topics in Biostatistics, Health Data Science or Public Health. Each student will focus on an individual topic which will is of interest to them.
The session will consist of brief presentations followed by group discussion. Each student will give a 5 minute presentation using 5-6 slides to aid in their presentation. This will include a brief overview of their topic of interest, 2 faculty members who currently work on this area of interest and any organizations that are involved in this area of research as well.
Student’s will hold questions and comments until the end of each presentation and then a group discussion will take place.

Exploring Biostatistics, Health Data Science or Public Health Further in Depth.


  1. Biostatistics, Health Data Science or Public Health topics
    • Students will present on one or more topics they are possibly interested in pursuing. If they do not have any ideas, they can just pick a topic that a professor in the department is working on.
  2. Faculty Researchers
    • Students will highlight 2 faculty members who are conducting research on their topic of interest. At least one of these faculty members should be affiliated with the department of Biostatistics.
  3. Organizations
    • Students will identify organizations that currently fund or aid in their research topic of interest. An obvious one in many cases is the NIH but there may be other groups within the Government, Private Sector or AMSTAT.

Readings

Students should identify at least 5 appropriate references for their topic and have read these.

Preparation for Meeting


Students will prepare a 5 minute presentation on topics of individual interest. Each presentation should consist of 5-6 slides and a possible 7th slide to display references. References should be in a style suggested by the New England Journal of Medicine for articles concerning Biomedical Research.

modalID: 2 title: Group Meeting 2 subtitle: Topics in Biostatistics, Health Data Science or Public Health. date: 2017-03-15 img: “2.jpg” preview: “2.jpg” category: Public Health Research description:

item.title: Group Meeting 1
item.description:
Introduction to Meetings and Group

Format

This is the first meeting. We will meet as a large group and discuss the format for this time. During this time we will consider:

  • What is a thesis/project?
  • What we will do through the rest of the meetings.
  • Address any and all questions regarding thesis

Group Discussion

The rest of the time available will be informal discussions. Student’s can ask about the upcoming semesters, information on courses, etc…

item.title: The Schedule
item.description:
Date Topic
Group Meeting 01, 03/01/2017 Introduction to Meetings and Group
Group Meeting 02, 03/15/2017 or 03/22/2017 Topics in Biostatistics, Health Data Science or Public Health.
Group Meeting 03, 04/05/2017 Large Group Meeting with Other Students
Group Meeting 04, 04/19/2017 or 04/26/2017 Report on an interview with a researcher in area of interest.
Group Meeting 05, 04/26/2017 or 05/03/2017 What is a Thesis/Project and How do you find the right advisor?
Group Meeting 06, 05/10/2017 or 05/17/2017 Preparing your Thesis Proposal

item.title: The "Playground section"
item.description: Here you can see the “playground”-section. It is used for less important content, wich isnt updated regulary and must not be in a strict structure. The special thing of this section is the fact, that every article is fully viewable and every article is on the same page (e.g. at /playground/).
